pageContext.claim: “Years ago, when Media was legitimate, people known as ‘Fact Checkers’ would always call to check and see if a story was accurate. Nowadays they don't use ‘Fact Checkers’ anymore, they just write whatever they want!”
pageContext.analysis: Some magazines such as the New Yorker are reputed to have rigorous fact-checking processes, but this type of fact-checking was never widespread in media. Reporters and editors nonetheless fact check articles even in publications that have no dedicated fact checkers. Reputable news organizations also correct their reporting errors when they occur. Trump was probably not referring to The Washington Post Fact Checker, which writes about him frequently.
